OC: The Earth wobbles on its axis, and its tilt and orbit change over many thousands of years, pushing the climate into and out of ice ages.
S: The sun's temperature varies over decades and centuries.
LU: Humans have cut, plowed, and paved more than hald the Earth's land surface. Dark forests are yielding to lighter patches, which reflect more sunlight.
O: Natural ozone high in the atmosphere blocks harmful sunlight. Closer to the Earth, ozone is created by pollution and traps heat.
